Sustainable sites

Site assessment Understand the importance of doing a site assessment. When should a site assessment occur? A site assessment assesses site conditions before design to evaluate sustainable options and inform related decisions about site design. What would a site assessment reveal? An assessment reviews the sites: Topography Hydrology Climate Vegetation... More »

Reuse Understand the best thing you can do for the environment is reuse materials. What is the environmental benefit of reusing a building? Adaptive reuse refers to the process of reusing an old site or building for a purpose other than which it was built or designed for. Adaptive reuse... More »

Site selection Locating a project in a dense area near diverse uses addresses ways to reduce pollution by reducing the number of single occupant drivers. What are examples of diverse uses? LEED process

Organization fundamentals Know the purpose of USGBC and what its goals are. What is the mission of USGBC? USGBC’s mission is “to transform the way buildings and communities are designed, built, and operated, enabling an environmentally and socially responsible, healthy, and prosperous environment that improves the quality of life”.
